sentences.sContent: In the recession, the company’s profits plunged 60%.
sentences.sCn: 萧条时期，那家公司的利润骤跌了60%。

sentences.sContent: A soldier plunged a bayonet into his body.
sentences.sCn: 一名士兵猛地将刺刀刺入了他的身体。

sentences.sContent: She plunged her face into a bowl of cold water.
sentences.sCn: 她猛地把脸浸入一盆冷水中。

phrases.pCn: 投入；跳入；突然或仓促地开始某事
冒险尝试；采取决定性步骤

words.tran: [机] 活塞；潜水者；跳水者；莽撞的人

trans.tranCn: 投入；一头进入；猛冲；猛跌，骤降
trans.tranOther: if a price, rate etc plunges, it suddenly decreases by a large amount

trans.tranCn: 把…投入；使突然陷入，遭受
trans.tranOther: If you plunge an object into something, you push it quickly or violently into it

trans.tranCn: 投身入水； 猛跌， 骤降； 使猛然投入、 进入、 陷入
trans.tranOther: a sudden large decrease in the price, value etc of something
